com.motorola.game
Class ImageUtil

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.motorola.game.ImageUtil
public class ImageUtil
extends java.lang.Object

ImageUtil provides methods useful methods related to the manipulation of Images. Specifically, it provides methods for setting and getting RGB values, and also provides the ability to create a scaled instance of an existing Image.

Field Detail

SCALE_REPLICATE

public static final int SCALE_REPLICATE
Replicate scaling method. This method duplicates or eliminates pixels in order to scale an image, thereby providing an image of reasonable quality very quickly. It is the default method and is supported by all platforms. This constant has a value of 0x0.

SCALE_AREA

public static final int SCALE_AREA
Area scaling method. This method provides an image of good quality but is slower than SCALE_REPLICATE, and it may not be supported by all platforms. This constant has a value of 0x1.

SCALE_SMOOTH

public static final int SCALE_SMOOTH
Smooth scaling method. This method provides an image of highest quality but is quite slow, and it may not be supported by all platforms. This constant has a value of 0x2.
Method Detail

getPixels

public static void getPixels(javax.microedition.lcdui.Image src,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             int width,
                             int height,
                             int[] rgbData)
                      throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Gets RGB pixel data from the specified region of the source image. The data is stored in the provided int array in row-major order using the standard 24-bit color format (0xRRGGBB). Note that the color information stored in the image may be subject to the capabilities of the device's display.
Parameters:
src - The source Image to retrieve the pixel data from
x - The horizontal location of left edge of the region
y - The vertical location of the top edge of the region
width - The width of the region
height - The height of the region
rgbData - The array in which the pixel data is to be stored
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the length of rgbData is less than width * height

getPixels

public static void getPixels(javax.microedition.lcdui.Image src,
                             int[] rgbData)
                      throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Gets RGB pixel data from the entirety of the source image. The data is stored in the provided int array in row-major order using the standard 24-bit color format (0xRRGGBB). Note that the color information stored in the image may be subject to the capabilities of the device's display.
Parameters:
src - The source Image to retrieve the pixel data from
rgbData - The array in which the pixel data is to be stored
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the length of rgbData is not sufficient (i.e. less than the number of pixels in the source image)

setPixels

public static void setPixels(javax.microedition.lcdui.Image dest,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             int width,
                             int height,
                             int[] rgbData)
                      throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets RGB pixel data in specified region of the destination image. The data must be stored in the int array in row-major order using the standard 24-bit color format (0xRRGGBB).
Parameters:
dest - The mutable destination Image whose pixels will be set
x - The horizontal location of left edge of the region
y - The vertical location of the top edge of the region
width - The width of the region
height - The height of the region
rgbData - The array of RGB pixel values
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the length of rgbData is less than width * height
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the destination image is immutable

setPixels

public static void setPixels(javax.microedition.lcdui.Image dest,
                             int[] rgbData)
                      throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets RGB pixel data in the entirety of the destination image. The data must be stored in the int array in row-major order using the standard 24-bit color format (0xRRGGBB).
Parameters:
dest - The mutable destination Image whose pixels will be set
rgbData - The array of RGB pixel values
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the length of rgbData is not sufficient (i.e. less than the number of pixels in the destination image)
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the destination image is immutable

getScaleImage

public static javax.microedition.lcdui.Image getScaleImage(javax.microedition.lcdui.Image src,
                                                           int width,
                                                           int height,
                                                           int method)
                                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a scaled version of the source image using the desired scaling method. All platforms must implement the SCALE_REPLICATE method; other methods may be optionally supported. SCALE_REPLICATE is used if the requested scaling method is not supported by the device.
Parameters:
src - The source Image
width - The width, in pixels, of the new Image
height - The height, in pixels, of the new Image
method - The desired method to be used to scale the image data.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the width or height is less than 1, or if the specified method is not a valid value (SCALE_REPLICATE, SCALE_AREA, or SCALE_SMOOTH)
